title: "NordVPN CyberSec.cer"
content:
Folks,

I have looked on the web for instructions on how to remove "NordVPN CyberSec.cer" from my General Settings and Enterprise Polices. The articles were no help.

At the top of the General page "Your Browser is being managed by your organization" is displayed. Clicking on the Blue Text String I go to about:policies, it shows "Certificates Install NordVPN CyberSec.cer".

When I click on errors - "Unable to find certificate - NordVPN CyberSec.cer" is shown.

I don't know how this may be affecting FoxFire.

I contacted NordVPN and asked them how to remove this "install item". Per their instructions, I deleted everything related to NordVPN.

The error continues after restarts.

The install/load request has to be coming from FoxFire; for Nord does not exist on my machine ( Mac Mini 10.15.7 FoxFire 106.0.1 (64bit ) ). Chrome has never been on my machine. I did trial NordVPN but do not use it.

How do I remove the install request?

creator: dnorthrop

title: Firefox warns some websites are not safe and doesn't load their CSS
content:
Recently I started a new job and received a laptop, so I've been setting up the laptop with all my stuff, including Firefox. At first I used Firefox's account sync feature, but it doesn't sync everything - my extensions' settings (not the extensions I have but what their settings are), my toolbar customization, all the sites I'm logged into, and maybe some other things are not sync'd. So instead I tried a different solution which has worked for me before - copying my profile folder on my PC and pasting it into the laptop. This mostly works, except suddenly Firefox warns that a lot of my company's websites are a potential security risk with the error code SEC_ERROR_UNKNOWN_ISSUER. I can get past this, but the real problem is some of these websites - namely GitHub - don't load any CSS anymore. I can access the site but it's ugly. Normal GitHub works, only my company's GitHub (which has a different URL) doesn't.

If I switch back to the other profile, it works. But I'd really like to avoid having to manually sync up my extension settings and other things. Is there any other way to resolve this? Thanks.
creator: ederyaviv

title: Can't IMport Passwords to Firefox

title: dropdown lists not displaying contents when selected (Firefox for Fedora Linux 105.0.2)
content:
Dropdown lists are not displaying their contents when selected on certain websites, including eBay.

I have tried using Troubleshoot Mode and the dropdowns are still not displaying.

Here's an example where I am seeing this behaviour: https://www.ebay.co.uk/itm/255536264049?var=555488018135

When I select the Resistance Level dropdown, nothing happens. It's the same for any listing that has a dropdown.

This issue occurs in both RPM and Flatpak instances of Firefox.

I have tried the same page in Chromium browser on the same computer and the dropdown functions correctly in that browser.

I have also noted the same behaviour on other websites, such as train booking sites, but I don't have any other examples to share at the moment. It isn't an isolated eBay issue anyway.

Any ideas? Is anyone else experiencing this issue?

title: Browser window isn't full screen
content:
Hi, Windows 11, Firefox 106.0.1 (64-bit).

Don't know what I've done but my browser window isn't displaying the full screen. I use my laptop connected via HDMI to my television (and have been for years) along with a wireless keyboard.

Attached images include:

  • Image at 100%
  • Image at 80%
  • Scale at 150% (recommended)
  • Text setting is at 140%
  • Advanced Display Info

For whatever reason, the right side of browser windows is being clipped off. Full screen doesn't help.

  1. Changing the screen size from 100% to 80% (Ctrl -, and - again) doesn't help.
  2. The scale setting in Windows is at 150% (the recommended setting), as always.
  3. The text setting is at 140% (I can make it smaller or larger with no change in behavior), but what I can comfortably see is 140%).
  4. I've included the Advanced Display Info page from the Systems Info.

Anyway, it's probably a setting I'm unfamiliar with, but I don't know for certain. Thank you in advance.

title: Firefox Account - How to STOP making new "service" device entries
content:
I do a lot of OS switching - I test various Linux distros on my 5 laptops and one really old 32 bit system for my mother-in-law and I am wondering if I can use FireFox Accounts over and over without making a new service device every time I need something from FF Accts :P

This has bugged my off and on for a long time but I have mostly ignored the issue ... until last week I discovered I had like 20 some odd devices on my account -- going back 2 years or more. Now, I signed out of many of them and I am down to about 15 -- mostly because I am a little confused about how FF Accts determines what to sync ... especially since I use FF for testing and the shouldnt be that much in each 'sync' device ...

So, is there a way to use FF Accts 'sync' to get my data to a new device without making a new 'synced' device?

Thx/Bill

PS - a few FF releases in the past I got what I wanted by just copying the .mozilla directory to the new system but that broke a few releases ago :P too bad stuff has to change :(

Also, please understand that I am on Android, iOS, MacOS, and Linux daily so trying to 'gather' what I am submitting this question on will not lend itself to trying to solve my insanity >< Sorry!

title: Request for a "Link to Highlight" feature like from Chromium based browsers
content:
Is it possible to request a feature for Firefox called "Link to Highlight"?

Chromium based browsers have a feature where you can make a selection of text on a webpage and in the right click context menu select: "Copy link to highlight", which copies a link to the webpage, with an appended selection like so: "#:~:text=Steps%20to%20reproduce%20the%20issue%3A". Then when the link is clicked, the Chromium based browser would scroll down to the match of the text, flash a colour to show where it is, and tint the text with a subtle highlight. The text in this example would then be "Steps to reproduce the issue.". This helps in my workflow when using a browser, so this feature would make me super happy.

title: ¿Cómo elimino la barra lateral y regreso a la configuración de ver el historial detallado en una nueva pestaña?
content:
Antes de migrar a Firefox, usaba Edge; la razón por la que realicé este cambio es porque cada vez que Edge se actualizaba, imponía cambios que no mejoraban realmente el uso del navegador y, por el contrario, lo limitaban.

Uno de estos cambios fue, precisamente, eliminar la página del historial y sustituirla por una barra lateral (de hecho, cuando noté que el historial se abrió en la barra lateral, inmediatamente pensé que me había equivocado y abierto Edge). Ahora bien, ¿qué ventajas ofrece la barra lateral? Si eres capaz de centrar tu vista y atención en 2 lugares de forma simultánea, supongo que puedes navegar el historial mientras lees un artículo, revisas tus redes sociales o ves una película, por ejemplo. Claro que eso también se podía hacer antes, sólo había que separar la pestaña del historial y acomodarla de forma que tuvieras el historial por un lado y el artículo, película, o lo-que-fuera del otro...

¿Y qué desventajas tiene limitar el historial a la barra lateral? La principal es que no hay información adicional sobre la fecha y hora en que se accedió al sitio, información importante cuando el título de la página no refleja su contenido. Otra desventaja es el hecho de que no se puede cambiar el tamaño de la fuente (deliberadamente pequeña para que quepan más caracteres en el limitado espacio de la barra lateral).

¿Alguien sabe de qué forma puedo regresar el historial a su vista anterior o qué otro navegador me ofrece esa posibilidad (Chrome lo hace, pero quiero "ayudar" a otras empresas no tan grandes)? De antemano, gracias.
